The Domes

Discover the architectural splendor and spiritual significance of the magnificent domes that crown Masjid Salman al Farsi.

{/* Main Dome Feature */}

The Central Dome

≡ƒòî

Architectural Marvel

The central dome of Masjid Salman al Farsi stands as a testament to Islamic architectural excellence, soaring 45 meters above the main prayer hall with a diameter of 25 meters. Its golden exterior catches the sunlight, creating a beacon that can be seen from miles around.

Key Specifications

  • ΓÇó Height: 45 meters (147 feet)
  • ΓÇó Diameter: 25 meters (82 feet)
  • ΓÇó Weight: 1,200 tons
  • ΓÇó Material: Gold-leaf covered copper
  • ΓÇó Construction: Traditional Islamic techniques
{/* Dome Collection */}

Dome Collection

≡ƒîÖ

Main Prayer Dome

The largest dome covering the main prayer hall, designed to enhance acoustics for prayers and sermons.

  • ΓÇó Acoustic engineering
  • ΓÇó Natural lighting system
  • ΓÇó Ventilation design
Γ¡É

Entrance Domes

Five smaller domes marking the main entrances, each with unique geometric patterns and calligraphy.

  • ΓÇó 15 meters diameter each
  • ΓÇó Quranic inscriptions
  • ΓÇó Blue mosaic tiles
≡ƒÆÄ

Courtyard Domes

Eight decorative domes surrounding the courtyard, creating a harmonious architectural composition.

  • ΓÇó 10 meters diameter each
  • ΓÇó Stained glass windows
  • ΓÇó Night illumination
{/* Design Elements */}

Design Elements & Symbolism

Islamic Geometry

The domes feature intricate geometric patterns based on sacred Islamic mathematics. The designs incorporate the golden ratio and complex star patterns that have been used in Islamic architecture for centuries.

Geometric Patterns

  • ΓÇó Eight-pointed stars (symbolizing paradise)
  • ΓÇó Hexagonal patterns (representing unity)
  • ΓÇó Interlacing circles (eternal life)
  • ΓÇó Sacred geometry proportions

Calligraphy & Inscriptions

Quranic verses and Islamic calligraphy adorn the dome interiors and exteriors, created by master calligraphers using traditional techniques passed down through generations.

Notable Inscriptions

  • ΓÇó Ayat al-Kursi (Throne Verse)
  • ΓÇó 99 Names of Allah
  • ΓÇó Surah Al-Ikhlas
  • ΓÇó Prophet's traditions
{/* Construction & Engineering */}

Engineering Excellence

≡ƒöº

Modern Engineering

Combining traditional Islamic architecture with modern seismic engineering and climate control systems.

≡ƒîí∩╕Å

Climate Control

Advanced ventilation and cooling systems maintain comfortable temperatures year-round.

≡ƒÆí

Lighting Design

Natural and artificial lighting systems create a spiritual atmosphere day and night.

{/* Virtual Experience */}

Experience the Domes

≡ƒÄÑ

360┬░ Dome Tour

Virtual Tour

Explore the domes in stunning 360┬░ detail from the comfort of your home

≡ƒÄº

Audio Guide

Audio Experience

{/* Visiting Information */}

Visiting the Domes

Best Viewing Times

Sunrise: Golden glow on domes

Photography Guidelines

ΓÇó Exterior photography: Permitted

ΓÇó Interior photography: With permission

Guided Architecture Tours: Available daily at 10:00 AM, 2:00 PM, and 4:00 PM. Book in advance for group visits.

import { Metadata } from 'next'; export const metadata: Metadata = { title: 'The Main Prayer Hall - Masjid Salman al Farsi', description: 'Experience the spiritual grandeur of the main prayer hall at Masjid Salman al Farsi, featuring stunning Islamic architecture and serene atmosphere', }; export default function MainPrayerHallPage() { return (

The Main Prayer Hall

Step into the sacred space where thousands gather daily for prayer, reflection, and spiritual connection.

{/* Hall Overview */}

Sacred Space Overview

≡ƒòî

A Spiritual Sanctuary

The main prayer hall spans an impressive 3,000 square meters, accommodating up to 2,000 worshippers. Designed with profound spiritual significance, every element serves to enhance the prayer experience and create an atmosphere of tranquility and devotion.

Hall Specifications

  • ΓÇó Area: 3,000 square meters
  • ΓÇó Capacity: 2,000 worshippers
  • ΓÇó Ceiling Height: 25 meters
  • ΓÇó Prayer Lines: 40 rows
  • ΓÇó Carpet Area: 2,800 square meters
{/* Architectural Features */}

Architectural Features

≡ƒîƒ

Central Dome

The magnificent dome creates perfect acoustics for prayers and sermons

  • ΓÇó Natural lighting
  • ΓÇó Acoustic perfection
  • ΓÇó Quranic calligraphy
≡ƒÅ¢∩╕Å

Marble Columns

48 majestic marble columns support the structure with Islamic geometric designs

  • ΓÇó Turkish marble
  • ΓÇó Gold inlay work
  • ΓÇó Geometric patterns
≡ƒÄ¿

Islamic Art

Intricate Islamic artwork and calligraphy adorn every surface

  • ΓÇó Hand-painted tiles
  • ΓÇó Quranic verses
  • ΓÇó Traditional motifs
{/* The Mihrab */}

The Mihrab (Prayer Niche)

≡ƒº¡

Direction of Prayer

The mihrab is a semi-circular niche in the wall that indicates the qibla, the direction of the Kaaba in Mecca. Our mihrab is a masterpiece of Islamic art, crafted from rare marble and adorned with gold leaf calligraphy.

Mihrab Features

  • ΓÇó Carved from single marble block
  • ΓÇó Gold leaf calligraphy
  • ΓÇó Quranic verse: "Face the direction of the Sacred Mosque"
  • ΓÇó Illuminated from within
  • ΓÇó Acoustic enhancement for Imam's voice
{/* The Minbar */}

The Minbar (Pulpit)

Platform of Knowledge

The minbar stands to the right of the mihrab, serving as the platform from which the Imam delivers the Friday sermon (khutbah) and other religious lectures. Our minbar is a work of art, featuring intricate woodwork and Islamic geometric patterns.

Craftsmanship Details

  • ΓÇó Hand-carved teak wood
  • ΓÇó 12 steps representing Islamic knowledge
  • ΓÇó Mother-of-pearl inlay
  • ΓÇó Arabic calligraphy panels
≡ƒôó
{/* Prayer Facilities */}

Prayer Facilities

≡ƒô┐

Prayer Mats

High-quality Turkish prayer mats

≡ƒôû

Quran Stands

Wooden rihal for Quran reading

≡ƒÄñ

Sound System

Crystal clear audio throughout

≡ƒÆí

Lighting

Soft, warm lighting for focus

{/* Special Features */}

Special Features

Acoustic Design

The prayer hall is engineered for perfect acoustics, ensuring the Imam's voice reaches every corner without distortion. The dome and walls are designed to minimize echo while enhancing vocal clarity.

  • ΓÇó Sound-absorbing materials
  • ΓÇó Strategic speaker placement
  • ΓÇó Natural echo control

Climate Control

Advanced climate systems maintain comfortable temperatures year-round, with specialized ventilation that respects Islamic prayer requirements while ensuring optimal air quality.

  • ΓÇó Silent air conditioning
  • ΓÇó Fresh air circulation
  • ΓÇó Humidity control
{/* Visiting Guidelines */}

Visiting the Prayer Hall

Etiquette & Guidelines

  • ΓÇó Maintain silence and respect during prayer times
  • ΓÇó Dress modestly and remove shoes before entering
  • ΓÇó Photography permitted outside prayer times only
  • ΓÇó Follow the guidance of mosque staff

Best Times to Visit

Morning: 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM (quiet)
Afternoon: 2:00 PM - 4:00 PM (moderate)
Evening: After Isha prayer (peaceful)

Guided Tours: Available daily. Experience the spiritual atmosphere and learn about the architectural significance. Advance booking recommended for groups.

Information We Collect

We collect information you provide directly to us, such as when you contact us, make donations, or subscribe to our newsletter.

We use the information we collect to provide, maintain, and improve our services, process donations, and communicate with you about our activities.

Information Sharing

Data Security

We implement appropriate security measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, alteration, disclosure, or destruction.

Contact Us

Shahadas

Whether you are just interested in Islam, have some questions or are ready to convert, we are happy to speak to you and guide you through the Shahada

What is Shahada?

The Shahada is the declaration of faith in Islam. It is the first and most important pillar of Islam, declaring belief in the oneness of Allah and that Muhammad is His messenger.

"Ash-hadu an la ilaha illallah, wa ash-hadu anna Muhammadan rasulullah"
I bear witness that there is no god but Allah, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His messenger

Learn & Understand

We offer comprehensive guidance for those interested in Islam. Our knowledgeable team can help you:

  • ΓÇó Understand the basic principles of Islam
  • ΓÇó Learn about the five pillars
  • ΓÇó Ask questions in a welcoming environment
  • ΓÇó Prepare for taking the Shahada

import { Metadata } from 'next'; export const metadata: Metadata = { title: 'Mosque Manners - Masjid Salman al Farsi', description: 'Essential etiquette and guidelines for worshippers at Masjid Salman al Farsi', }; export default function MosqueMannersPage() { return (

Mosque Manners & Etiquette

Learn the proper etiquette and conduct for visiting and praying at Masjid Salman al Farsi.

{/* Before Entering the Mosque */}

Before Entering the Mosque

1

Perform Wudu (Ablution)

Cleanse yourself before entering the house of Allah

2

Dress Modestly

Wear clean, modest clothing covering the body appropriately

3

Remove Shoes

Leave shoes in the designated areas before entering

4

Enter with Right Foot

Enter the mosque with your right foot first

5

Recite Du'a

Make du'a upon entering: "Allahumma aftah li abwaba rahmatik"

6

Pray Two Rak'ah

Perform Tahiyyatul masjid (greeting prayer) before sitting

{/* Inside the Mosque */}

Inside the Mosque

Prayer Etiquette

  • ΓÇó Fill front rows first
  • ΓÇó Straighten prayer lines
  • ΓÇó Stand shoulder to shoulder
  • ΓÇó Focus in prayer

General Conduct

  • ΓÇó Maintain silence
  • ΓÇó No loud conversations
  • ΓÇó Respect worshippers
  • ΓÇó Keep phone silent

Remembrance

  • ΓÇó Engage in dhikr
  • ΓÇó Read Quran quietly
  • ΓÇó Make personal du'a
  • ΓÇó Reflect on blessings
{/* Special Guidelines */}

Special Guidelines

For Sisters

  • ΓÇó Use designated prayer areas
  • ΓÇó Wear modest hijab and loose clothing
  • ΓÇó Avoid strong perfumes
  • ΓÇó Maintain privacy and modesty

For Children

  • ΓÇó Teach them mosque etiquette early
  • ΓÇó Keep them quiet during prayers
  • ΓÇó Bring quiet activities if needed
  • ΓÇó Encourage participation in age-appropriate ways
{/* Prohibited Actions */}

What to Avoid

Inside Prayer Hall

  • Γ£ù Eating or drinking
  • Γ£ù Loud talking or laughing
  • Γ£ù Using mobile phones
  • Γ£ù Sleeping unless necessary

General Conduct

  • Γ£ù Rushing through prayers
  • Γ£ù Disturbing others
  • Γ£ù Leaving during khutbah without reason
  • Γ£ù Crossing in front of praying people
{/* Rewards and Benefits */}

Rewards of Proper Mosque Etiquette

Error: Calling setState synchronously within an effect can trigger cascading renders

Effects are intended to synchronize state between React and external systems such as manually updating the DOM, state management libraries, or other platform APIs. In general, the body of an effect should do one or both of the following:
* Update external systems with the latest state from React.
* Subscribe for updates from some external system, calling setState in a callback function when external state changes.

Calling setState synchronously within an effect body causes cascading renders that can hurt performance, and is not recommended. (https://react.dev/learn/you-might-not-need-an-effect).
